entries.femaleVariant: V's here. Hey.
It's about time, too. We're nearly done finalizing the plan.
Kurt Hansen...
Used to be a football stadium?
BARGHEST command structure – tell me.
Kurt Hansen... bit younger, looks like. Guess the royal asshole look is nothin' new.
Nighthawks, huh?
So, they get exfilled? What, Hansen loved NC so much he came back years later?
A pro football dream team, funded by big Pacifica investors. Won every game they played.
BARGHEST's core, inner circle – ex-Militech commandos?
They're drivin' a rental while in NC. An exploitable openin'.
And your role in all this, Reed?
OK, back to Night City, folks. With our sights trained on a new target.
I do... And yes, the ruse is not that different, but the stakes are.
Mhm, yeah-yeah. So like Medellín. Or Night City a few years later.
A classic copy-and-paste with ID-matching, bioscans, behaviorals – all bases covered.
Lemme see… Global arms trade – check. Personality theft – check. Oh, and gross overconfidence – biiig check.
A still from the Unification War days. Night City, Operation Midnight Storm – he was in command.
His unit was spread out along the bottom of an open storm channel, awaitin' reinforcements. An Arasaka supercarrier docked in the bay instead.
No. NUS-Militech Command left them to die. The op got swept under the rug, so Hansen did eventually claim the zone... just not for us.
The man he is today, the situation we're in... it's all the fruit of poor decisions we've made.
Been here before, Reed. 'S exactly like then.
A specific op brought them to NC under Hansen's command. They're only a dozen or so strong.
Outside lookin' in, they seem rock-solid. Actually, they're anything but. Without Hansen, the command structure crumbles.
What happened in Medellín? What was the op there?
So... what happened?
We had our sights trained on a guy who sat in the Colombian president's back pocket, sold 'im smuggled corptech.
You sayin' the FIA pulls strings overseas?
A lot of what we do doesn't get printed in the normsheets.
Anyway, we used stolen identities on that mission, too. Things didn't go exactly as planned, but that's... a long story.
Well, So Mi had put together Hernandez's dossier...
Problem was, an important detail slipped through the cracks – the engineer's abject fear of dogs. Cold sweat, shaky hands, soggy pantleg – that kind of fear.
When the doberman sniffed Alex's knee, she... pats 'im on the head and says "who's a good boy?" Then, she went to pull up a chair at Hernandez's table...
Before she could sit down, they had two barrels to her head and one trained at the base of her spine.
What did you do?
How'd you get 'er out?
Worked out, though, right? We're all here, now, together.
What'd you do?
Well, my hands are bound, got a sack on my head, hear a collapsible baton snap into place – thwack. I did what anyone'd do in that sitch.
I lied my fuckin' ass off. Don't sit quite straight to this day, though.
Mhh... Which can't be said for Hernandez and his men. We took any possibility of that from them.
All thought of subterfuge went "poof." We had to kick the door down. A "rival cartel" wiped 'em out – that was the official version.
Yeah, all four of 'em.
Franchise went belly up, like everything else here. A few years later. Hansen moved in.
I'll provide transport, make sure the path's clear and problem-free.
Our person of interest was one Luis Hernandez, arms tradin' heavyweight. We aimed to plant our own SA in his organization.
Alex had adopted the identity of an engineer from Hernandez's entourage. She was our ticket in.
She walks in to attend a meeting one day, she sees one of Luis's bikini-model girlfriends prancing out, on her way to walk his doberman. Spending big money on kitsch luxury – it was kind of his MO.
So you say.
Can do a lot more than play dress-up, thank you.
Plus, element of total surprise in my corner. Still, sweet of you to worry.
'Member last time we had this convo?
Thought you didn't believe in coincidences.
Alex...
Gave 'er free rein back then, too.
That's not exactly the same, not an adequate comparison…
You know I'm right.
Mhm... So you say.
Op not sittin' well with ya, Alex?
Before NC, we worked an op in Colombia. Medellín – Song's first mission.
Yeah, shouldn't waste time.
Nah, 'cmon, Colombia – tell me.
Just a small difference of opinion to iron out.
Mission not to your liking, Alex?
Reminds me of a few other sitches we handled. One in particular sticks out.
Not now, Alex. We have enough to do without diggin' up ancient history.
Let's hear it.
Maybe another time.
Think we can spare sixty seconds. Hell, might even learn somethin' about So Mi that'll prove useful.
Tale for another time, sounds like. Got a lot on our plate as it is.
C'mon, lemme show you what we have.
We've parsed the intel from the shard So Mi gave us.
It's a solid foundation for the mission we wanna run.
Surveillance, recon, data gatherin', plannin' – it's all done.
That's where you come in, V. We'll need you to breach the rental firm's trackin' system. Alex'll fill you in later.
All clear? If you have any questions, now's the time to ask.
Things couldn't be clearer. Let's get to work.
So, time we talked about nabbin' the 'runners?
entries.maleVariant: So, time we talked nabbin' the 'runners?

entries.femaleVariant: Cover that in a minute.
Describe the BARGHEST rank-and-file?
Honestly, that this one choom managed to build an army inside NC? That's just wild to me.
The bulk of his force are local thugs. Hansen's inner circle equipped 'em, trained 'em, albeit minimally.
Gear's not standard issue.
His gear – not exactly standard issue Militech spec ops...
Good eye. That's a Yakut knife. Useful for you name it – skinnnin' animals, cleanin' fish, combat... A souvenir from Siberia. Same goes for his pistol.
What's the stadium used for now?
Stadium – what's it used for now?
Hansen's made it a one-stop shop for the world's smugglers and warlords.
All right...
They're overgrown kids. They do somethin' street-level to get noticed, they get a gun. Stayin' alive gets 'em a bulletproof vest or some other contraband toy. That's how it works.
Goons with prototype iron that "fell off the back of the truck". Nova.
entries.maleVariant: Goons with prototype iron that "fell off the back of a truck". Nova.

entries.femaleVariant: Fightin' a war at the edge of the world and short a panzer company or two? No problem.
You meet with Hansen, transfer the eds, he gives the signal. Before you know it, your new tanks are bein' delivered in international waters, droppin' out of orbit if necessary.
Gotta hand to 'im – Hansen knows what he's doin'.
I agree.
Leading a gang of wannabe-soldier thugs?
Night City could be the tip of an iceberg. Stockpiles of high-demand product, massive supply chains, bought-off politicians...
Impressive enterprise.
No, Hansen is just not your average thug with a military past.
entries.maleVariant: No, Hansen is not just your average thug with a military past.

entries.femaleVariant: Globetrotter, is he?
Mhm. He picked up a few things on his overseas ops. Blade fetish, knife-fightin' skills. He's known to be good.
Right. Let's get to work.
Story for another time, maybe.
Are you even listenin'?
You with us, V?
Followin' along all right?
You've had a look at everything. Good.
V, join us.
Ya gonna keep us waitin'?
Right, our objective – to free So Mi from under Hansen's duress. Unfortunately, this ain't a normal rescue op, because...
...Well, she's been infected with somethin' from beyond the Blackwall. A consequence of her service to the NUS and President Myers.
I'm not about to pretend I understand the tech whys and hows. The important thing is – if she doesn't get treatment, it'll kill 'er.
[Take shard] Alex has it right.
Alex nailed it. If anyone's to blame, it's Myers, not you.
Stop worryin', Reed. We'll get 'er out, save 'er.
[Take shard] We'll get 'er out of this.
It's high time we... righted some of the wrongs of the past.
Fuck off, Reed, give it a rest, will, ya? Nothin' here's your fault.
Woman's an adult, made her own decisions. Consequences caught up to 'er.
No, she was manipulated. There was no one around who could've had her back.
Here, V. Mission details on this.
You might be right. But so am I.
I know. And not just her – latter goes for you, too.
The cure is an AI that "lives" on a neural matrix.  Hansen possesses said matrix now. We aim to seize it.
What's the plan?
So, this neural matrix – how much do we know?
All right – plan, lemme hear it.
What do we know about the neural matrix?
Experimental tech nested in a mainframe that someone dragged up from deep beneath Dogtown...
From a bunker, to be exact. Part of Project Cynosure – a joint US-Militech operation mounted in a bid to counter Arasaka's Soulkiller.
The matrix itself is a functional container. It houses an AI from beyond the Blackwall, and it's design lets the user deploy the AI for a specific purpose – in our case, to fix you and Songbird.
Hansen'll meet with the netrunners you already know. The meeting itself is our chance to get close – to Song and the matrix.
Hansen hired the French duo 'cause they worked for Militech years back. They know its security protocols inside out.
Also, they're sellin' Hansen access codes. Handy when Songbird goes to extract the matrix from the Cynosure mainframe.
Runners' scans and behaviorals we have. Now we just need to take those twins outta the equation.
A kidnapping, then.
Twins – who are they, exactly?
Aymeric and Aurore Cassel... we know anything more beyond what we saw firsthand?
Yep. Songbird put together full profiles for both.
Super short brief – they got their start at Militech, and dove in deep. That is, till they learned the pay's better on the dark side...
I buy that. Sure didn't hide their love of eddies.
Mhm. Gonna miss that next paycheck 'cause they ran into us. We're gonna nab 'em before they reach Hansen.
So, we kidnap 'em. How we wanna do this?
We're gonna track their ride and hijack it. Before they reach Hansen at the stadium.
Once we have the 'runners, you'll take their place. The behavioral imprints are tuned already.
The last stage – meet with Hansen?
What's your role in this?
I'm drawin' up your exfil route. Once you complete the mission, you'll need to get out in a hurry.
Brings us to the final stage, right? Meeting with Hansen?
entries.maleVariant: Brings us to the final stage, right? Meetin' with Hansen.

entries.femaleVariant: Right, where you'll sell 'im the access codes to the mainframe. In other words – the key to unlockin' your medicine cabinet.
One of you will join So Mi in the lab to feed in the codes when needed. Hansen's likely to keep the other at his side. Collateral.
I'll stay with Hansen, you'll join Songbird.
Once the data floodgates're open, you'll signal me. Gonna disarm Hansen, take him and his guards out.
You mean to kill Hansen.
Hansen and his goons – aim to handle 'em on your own...?
Sounds like flatlinin' Hansen's set in stone...
Order came directly from Myers. Confirmed at this stage... He took a potentially lethal swipe at the President of the NUS.
And... Songbird?
We have to rescue her. Myers told you as much herself.
All clear.
Tell me again – what's first?
What's our overall goal again?
How much does Myers know? What'd you tell 'er?
First step – what was it again?
Main goal – wanna make sure I'm clear.
How much've you told Myers? What's she know?
Securing a trace on the netrunners' car. This bit's on you. Alex will expand on that in a minute.
Meanwhile we'll make sure the personality data and imprints are airtight.
We're springing Songbird free of Hansen's iron grip. And seizin' tech that's gonna save your lives.
You 'n' Alex enter the stadium as Hansen's visiting netrunners. Disguises are key to the op.
That So Mi's fallen into the hands of the man who organized the downing of Space Force One.
Is that all?
All for now.
Think you'll be OK on your own?
Hansen built his own army.
Hm, stadium.
The stadium.
Ah, V, you're here.
So, BARGHEST – it's ex-Militech at its core?
Hansen's gunnin' for data from what he knows was a secret Militech-NUS research project. He has no idea the neural matrix is in there, too.
How's it goin'?
And? How's progress?
Trust restored between you two?
Back on the same page, are we?
Not exactly... Brings back a lot of memories, all this. One in particular sticks out.
